data.question: What is the empirical formula of MOF 1?
What method was used for the absorption correction of single-crystal XRD data for compound 1?
What is the space group of MOF 1?
At what temperature was the single-crystal XRD data for compound 1 collected?
What is the Zn/Li ratio in the lithiated MOF catalyst 1-Li?
How does the enantiomeric excess (ee) of the cyanation product change when using 0.5 mol% of (R)-1-Li compared to 1 mol% of (R)-Me4L-Li?
data.answer: The ee is higher with 0.5 mol% of (R)-1-Li.

data.question: True or False: The crystal structure of MOF 1 remains intact after adsorption of methyl orange dye.
True or False: The BET surface area of 1-Li is higher than that of the pristine MOF 1.
What is the effect of recycling the 1-Li catalyst on the enantiomeric excess (ee) of the cyanation product?
data.answer: The ee remains consistent across multiple cycles.

data.question: True or False: The PXRD pattern of the post-modified sample 1-Li2 matches exactly with the simulated PXRD of MOF 1.
What is the yield of (S)-bufuralol synthesized using the (R)-MOF catalyst?
True or False: The CO2 adsorption capacity of 1-Li is greater than that of the pristine MOF 1.
What is the role of water in the catalytic cyanation of aldehydes using 1/n-BuLi?
True or False: The catalytic activity of 1-Li is unaffected by the presence of water.
What is the effect of decreasing the catalyst/substrate (C/S) ratio from 1:100 to 1:1000 on the catalytic performance of 1-Li?
data.answer: The catalytic performance improves at a lower C/S ratio.

data.question: True or False: The structural integrity of MOF 1 is compromised after lithiation to form 1-Li.
What is the effect of recycling the 1-Li catalyst on its CO2 adsorption capacity?
data.answer: The CO2 adsorption capacity decreases slightly after recycling.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of (S)-bufuralol using the (R)-MOF catalyst results in a product with 99% enantiomeric excess.
What is the effect of the catalyst loading on the conversion rate in the cyanation of aldehydes?
data.answer: Higher catalyst loading generally leads to higher conversion rates.

data.question: True or False: The PXRD pattern of MOF 1 changes significantly after dye adsorption.
